units.title: Crypt isolation and initial organoid culture
units.text: Crypt isolation was performed as previously reported45 with modifications. Briefly, tissues were washed with DPBS to remove debris. The tissues were treated with 2.5 mM EDTA at 4 °C for 40 minutes to release crypts. The supernatant containing crypts was collected and embedded in Cultrex RGF BME (R&D Systems) droplets in 48-well plates (~50 crypts/well). After solidification, droplets were overlaid with culture medium containing 10 μM Y-27632 (TargetMol). The medium was changed every 3 days.
units.rationale: Describes the step‑by‑step procedure to isolate crypts and start organoid cultures.

units.title: Electroporation of LGR5 reporter constructs
units.text: Two LGR5-targeting sgRNAs were cloned into SpCas9-equipped HP180 plasmids (a gift from Hui Yang lab), generating LGR5 sgRNA plasmids and HDR template were co-electroporated into human intestinal organoids using a NEPA21 electroporator (Nepa Gene) following published methods45.
units.rationale: Specifies the method for introducing the fluorescent reporter into organoids.

units.title: Selection and expansion of reporter organoid colonies
units.text: Organoid colonies derived from single cells were manually picked, expanded, and genotyped.
units.rationale: Outlines the post‑electroporation step to obtain clonal reporter lines.

units.title: Paneth cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Paneth cells. EGF (50 ng/mL), IGF-I (100 ng/mL), FGF-2 (50 ng/mL), DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM), pVc (100 μg/mL) and IL-22 (2 ng/mL). Culture for 3 days.
units.rationale: Provides the exact cocktail and timing to drive Paneth cell fate.

units.title: Goblet cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Goblet cells. SJ000291942 (10 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM) and DAPT (10 μM) for 2 days and then replace CHIR with IWR-1 (2 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Details the sequential small‑molecule treatment to generate goblet cells.

units.title: Enteroendocrine cell differentiation protocol
units.text: Enteroendocrine cells. DMH1 (2 μM), R-spondin1 CM (10%), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), CHIR (4 μM), DAPT (10 μM) and CP673451 (0.5 μM) for 2 days, and then DMH1 (2 μM), Gastrin I (10 nM), A83-01 (0.5 μM), DAPT (10 μM), CP673451 (0.5 μM) and Gefitinib (5 μM) for 3 days.
units.rationale: Lists the two‑phase small‑molecule regimen for enteroendocrine differentiation.

units.title: EdU proliferation assay in organoids
units.text: Organoid culture medium was supplemented with 10 µM EdU (ethynyl-2’-deoxyuridine, Beyotime) and incubated for 1 hour.
units.rationale: Specifies the labeling step to measure cell proliferation.

units.title: Switch to differentiation media
units.text: Organoids were induced to differentiate by directly changing the culture media to differentiation media.
units.rationale: Defines the trigger that initiates the differentiation protocols.

units.title: Small‑molecule screening strategy schematic
units.text: Schematic of small molecules screening strategy for induction of differentiated cell types.
units.rationale: Indicates the overall experimental design for identifying effective differentiation cues.
